text: The Royal Zoological Society of Scotland is a learned society and registered charity based in Edinburgh, Scotland. It was founded by, Thomas Haining Gillespie, in 1909. In 1913, Edinburgh Town Council bought a large plot of land on Corstorphine Hill for the society - this later opened to the public as Edinburgh Zoo. The Society received its Royal Charter in 1913.Cf. http://www.rzss.org.uk/about-rzss The principal objective of the Society mentioned in the original charter is: > To promote, facilitate and encourage the study of zoology and kindred > subjects and to foster and develop amongst the people an interest in and > knowledge of animal life.
